name: places/ChIJr8q_LtP3wokR0eT1FFT_KZo
formattedAddress: 1752 Park Ave, New York, NY 10035, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1752 Park Ave, New York, NY 10035, USA

originalText.text:
Very understaffed, which is not good for the patients. Staff rarely  answers phones when you call, to check on relatives. Some of the  nursing staff are rude, and portray lack of interest, when trying to engage with them regarding  questions/ status of  our loved one. Reception area on floor where my Aunt was, showed lack of interest in assisting us when we had  questions, even when trying to locate nurse on duty taking care of our loved one.

My Aunt was so uncomfortable and became depressed, after   a nurse that tended to her,  was mean, and yelled at her. After my aunt was there for about 2 weeks, our family decided to have  my Aunt taken to a different facility,  where she is now happy, comfortable and improving.

It’s a beautiful building on the inside, but lacks the necessary and sufficient staff, needed to care for patients there, as well as, the staff needing more  professional, customer service and compassion training.

originalText.text: My aunt is a permanent resident here; it’s been about 2 years and we are BEYOND pleased and happy with her care. The staff is caring, the building is nice and clean. She is in good hands and we APPRECIATE everyone that is involved in making sure she is taken care of. The only downside is there is not enough staff (as everywhere else) and the staff that is here works hard and should have more help.  I would give it more stars if I could.

originalText.text: Horrible horrible staff. Everyone is so rude and belligerent. Very disrespectful. I actually felt safer leaving the hospital than i did when I entered

text.text: Horrible horrible staff. Everyone is so rude and belligerent. Very disrespectful. I actually felt safer leaving the hospital than i did when I entered

originalText.text:
This has to be one of the worst care facility in New York. The doctors and nurses are very neglectful. They are also very hostile and disrespectful when you mention their carelessness. I have a family member there since 2016 and we have been complaining on them since. This facility is one of very few that cares for patients with ALS in New York City, so we are almost forced to keep our family member here. If location didn't play a factor, she would have been moved a long time ago! Our family member have actually called the ambulance for herself twice just to receive immediate care! She has developed all kinds of sores!

Avoid this place!

originalText.text:
My father being in this facility for about 3 months now on the 4th floor 4w,  the staff don't care about the patients at all. I have to constantly remind them about cleaning him (brush his teeth, change position etc), take his temperature and sugar level, I also have found my father with bruises on his forehead and other parts of his body, and no-one can explain what happened. Also when you need assistance no one is around.
Worst place ever, I am taking pics and taking notes of everything cause I am building a case against this place. So sad to have people that don't have the passion and love to take care of others and are the ones taking care of our love ones
